summary: This document is an email chain from July 2021 regarding travel arrangements for a witness to be interviewed in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The correspondence involves Assistant U.S. Attorneys and staff from the Southern District of New York coordinating logistics for a witness interview scheduled for July 29th.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting steps to arrange travel for a witness in the Maxwell case. Based at the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Witness Interview in Maxwell Case
events.description: Scheduled interview with a witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, requiring the witness to travel for the meeting.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A witness interview for the Ghislaine Maxwell case was scheduled for July 29, 2021.
The witness was based out of town and required travel arrangements to New York for the interview.
The correspondence involves Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York coordinating the logistics.
The document indicates standard procedural steps for witness coordination in a federal prosecution.
